name: Mexican Street Corn Niblets (Esquites)

ingredients.ingredient: cotija cheese, crumbled (or feta or parmesan)

instructions: In a skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter and add the corn niblets.
Sauté until the corn is lightly charred or fully heated through, about 5–7 minutes.
If using garlic, stir it in and cook for another 30 seconds until fragrant.
Remove from heat and stir in mayonnaise, lime juice, and chili powder.
Add crumbled cotija cheese and toss to coat.
Season with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika if using.
Top with chopped cilantro and an extra squeeze of lime if desired.
Serve warm in bowls or cups, with more cheese and Tajín sprinkled on top if you like.

storage_tips.room_temp: Not recommended to store at room temperature for food safety.
storage_tips.refrigeration: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat gently before serving.
storage_tips.freezing: Not ideal for freezing due to the mayo and cheese.
